review_title: Only if your only other option is homelessness
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Greeley, CO

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Greeley, CO
pros: A little more schedule autonomy than most

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Greeley, CO
pros:
- Amazing supervisors and program directors who genuinely care about each individual clinician and go out of their way to make everyone feel seen and heard. 
- Freedom to think outside of the box and be creative
- Company focuses on team building and having fun by planning events and weekly group supervisions
- You work with a challenging population that encourages constant growth and learning
- Employs clinicians who are different from one another and utilize different modalities, which encourages clinicians to learn from one another and grow in how they approach clients
cons:
- The agency doesn’t put much effort into continued education or training opportunities for its clinicians
- There are cliques among clinicians and it’s often intimidating for new clinicians and long term ones alike. Some clinicians will make under their breath comments in group supervisions that can make you feel unwelcome
- Due to the high need for clinicians many staff are not held to the same expectations in regard to client care or sharing the burden of large caseloads. Rather than terminate less effective and capable therapists, team leads continuously give other clinicians more because of their abilities, which leads to resentment and burnout.

review_title: Love the company, hate the micromanaging supervisor
job_title: Case Manager in Greeley, CO
pros: So many great things about this company! They care about their staff and the work we do is meaningful. I love working face to face with clients and helping them through their struggles. I love serving in this community.
cons: In my department, there is not enough work to do and the boss is extremely micromanaging. I can't talk to anyone or even send an email to anyone without clearing it with her first. I have never felt so frustrated in a job before. I have been applying everywhere else in the company so I can get away from my current supervisor and the constant micromanagement.

review_title: Depends on who your supervisor is

job_title: Substance Abuse Counselor in Greeley, CO

job_title: Behavior Therapist in Greeley, CO
pros: I love my job at True North
cons: I’m moving to New Mexico

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Greeley, CO
pros: The management really cares about the employees and clients all the way up through the CEO who is a social worker himself. The company culture is very giving and supportive. Continued education and training are offered.
cons: The only downside I've seen is the location - it's not terribly convenient to run out for lunch if you don't choose to take a full hour. Kitchens/break rooms are on-site though so there are nice amenities. Greeley also has a lot to offer in terms of culture and activities.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Greeley, CO
pros: Middle management was kind and very open to feedback. They worked hard to make people feel appreciated. Many coworkers were nice and collaborative. The experience was not as bad as you might expect for a community mental health job. Some folks consider the social connectivity among colleagues to be one of the biggest pros. If you fit in, it will certainly be a pro. However, there are certainly cons to the social dynamics as not everyone will fit in.
cons: PTO is advertised in a misleading way. Communication between departments isn't great. Some teams seem to have a lack of diversity in age range, likely because there are mostly entry level clinicians due to low pay and lack of advancement opportunities. There are some social cliques that can make it hard to fit in. Whispering, saving seats in meetings, inside jokes, and overall social dynamics can make those not in the inner circle feel left out. Shared office spaces make it hard to avoid this type of issue. These social dynamics can also make group supervision feel uncomfortable. Feeling like the third wheel should not be a daily issue, especially when you are in the midst of work in your own office space, trying to mind your own business while maintaining social boundaries.

job_title: Psychiatrist in Greeley, CO
pros: This Community Mental Health Center has a great group of Medical Providers, therapists and ancillary staff.  Benefits are excellent.  Time off to attend CME conferences.  Good benefits.
cons: Honestly,  it is hard to think of any downside to working at this facility.  Many counselors get there start at this facility as their is a University in the town that has a Master's level counseling program.

job_title: Counselor in Greeley, CO
pros: Lots of opportunities for learning & training. Diverse range of programs & community connections are beneficial for both employees & clients. Fun co-workers.
cons: The pay and benefits could definitely be better, but that is somewhat expected in this field. The location is less than ideal.

review_title: One of the better places to work
job_title: Clinician in Greeley, CO
pros: Great culture and management cares about clients and the mission a lot. Pay isn’t great but also not terrible. Lots of employee appreciation.
cons: They advertise their PTO as being better than it is. Individual benefits are great. Family benefits are terrible. Shop the market instead.

job_title: Peer Counselor in Greeley, CO

cons: The teamwas not encouraged to develop skills in contemporary modalities.
